revised_title: Crystal Structure Analysis of Trimethyl (Acetylacetonyl-) 2:2 Platinum Complex
tldr: The authors conducted an X-ray crystal structure analysis of a trimethyl (acetylacetonyl-) 2:2 platinum complex, revealing that the platinum atom is octahedrally coordinated to three methyl groups, two nitrogen atoms of the bipyridyl, and the central carbon atom of the acetylacetone. This is the first example of a -diketone acting as an unidentate ligand solely through a carbon atom.
